column4: anybody willing to copy their unstable dist line from /etc/apt/sources.list for me?
you mean you want to install firestarter from hoary onto a warty installation?
the version of firestarter in the ubuntu stable is < 1.0 so no dhcp config support
which i was hoping to use.
you could get the hoary source and build  a package on warty. it's more likely to succeed than trying to install the binary
i got the source from the firestarter home page, it failed tom configure with a perl dependency
i figured, before i went to a lot of hassle, maybe i could get apt-get to do it, just for this package
use debianized sources from hoary, they will build more easily (with apt)
insert the hoary source repository in your sources.list. then do 'apt-get build-depend firestarter'. then 'apt-get source -b firestarter' and voila! you have a working package
i'll give that a whirl. i haven't heard of the backports project... the first time i tried ubuntu was today. it's only the second debian installation i've done (much more experience w/rh)
well, you may find a backport too
did you say that firestarter is in universe? yes, i think thats the <1.0 version i got initially
i mean if you get the hoary source, that'll be in hoary universe as well :)
they do. but the hoary package probably won't work on warty, so you need to build one, or find a backport. i recommend building
ok, let me see if i can find a backport then.
thanks a ton! i love ubuntu so far! (loved debian previously, but that was my ISP's installation; love it slightly less now that I've actually tried doing a fresh install)
